definition: to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: Cause nothing can break this tie.
sentences.chinese: 没有人可以割断偶们得联系。

sentences.english: The external cutter slips over the fish or tubing to be cut.
sentences.chinese: 外割刀在准备要割断的落鱼或油管上滑动。

sentences.english: The worker broke the circuit by disconnecting the wires.
sentences.chinese: 这名工人通过割断电线切断了电路。

sentences.english: Braid will cut right through that stuff.
sentences.chinese: 编织线会直接把草割断。

sentences.english: We must never sever the cultural vein of our nation.
sentences.chinese: 我们不能割断民族的文化血脉。

sentences.english: I have double it up further to ensure that the fish won't be able to cut the line easily.
sentences.chinese: 为了提防石甲再把钓线割断，我便放了双层的编线。

sentences.english: When the workmen found it was impossible for me to break loose, they cut all the strings that bound me.
sentences.chinese: 工人们看到我跑不掉了，就割断了一切捆缚我的绳子。

sentences.english: The mouth of the righteous brings forth wisdom, but the perverse tongue will be cut off.
sentences.chinese: 义人的口滋生智慧，乖谬的舌必被割断。

sentences.english: Mencius once played truant, and she cut the cloth she was weaving to show her seriousness.
sentences.chinese: 一次孟子逃学，孟母就割断织机的布来教子。

sentences.english: But this net break very tidily, was obviously cut off by the sharp weapon.
sentences.chinese: 而这网断的很整齐，明显是被利器割断了的。

sentences.english: In case of emergency use pointed end to strike the car window glass if passe…
sentences.chinese: 车祸时用来打碎车窗玻璃，割断安全带，紧急逃生。

sentences.english: A downhole tool used to cut tubing or similar tubulars that have become stuck in the wellbore.
sentences.chinese: 割断已卡在井筒的油管或类似管子所用的井下工具。

sentences.english: Drawing a small knife from my belt, I cut off both the eagle's feet.
sentences.chinese: 我从窑里拔出一把小刀，割断鹰的双脚。

sentences.english: The war disrupted the connections of many people.
sentences.chinese: 战争使许多人的联系被割断了。

sentences.english: The flood cut the townspeople off from the rest of the world.
sentences.chinese: 洪水割断了该镇居民与外界的联系。

definition: to cut off/to chop sth in half
at the base/at the root/(of a leg) just below the crutch
to hit with a piercing blow
to break or cut in two/to sever/to cut off/(fig.) to cut off (a conversation, a flow etc)/to interrupt/(math.) to truncate
to cut open/to rip/to streak across (lightning, meteor etc)/to pierce (scream, searchlight etc)
to detain/to hold back by force/to buckle/to hook
